meanings.definition: Capable of absorbing or soaking up liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sponge is very absorptive, quickly soaking up any spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The paper towel's absorptive quality makes it perfect for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty soil was so absorptive that it drank up all the rain in minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an absorptive sponge, eagerly taking in every new idea.
meanings.sent5: The black hole's absorptive nature was so strong that not even light could escape its grasp.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to take in or assimilate information or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The young student had an absorptive mind, quickly grasping new concepts.
meanings.sent2: Curious children often have an absorptive capacity for learning new things.
meanings.sent3: The detective's absorptive memory helped him solve the case in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her absorptive intellect allowed her to understand complex theories with ease.
meanings.sent5: The library was an absorptive haven for those seeking knowledge and wisdom.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to absorb or consume something.
meanings.sent1: The voracious eater had an absorptive appetite, finishing his meal in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The market displayed an absorptive demand for the new product, selling out within hours.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's absorptive behavior towards treats always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The absorptive nature of the forest seemed to swallow all sounds, creating a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The desert's absorptive heat made it unbearable to walk barefoot on the sand.
